table.name: console_user
table.description: A console specific table that is used to store console users

column.name: salt
column.description: Salt used in encryption, null if no salt

column.name: encrypt_meth
column.description: Encryption method for password, i.e. SHA-1 or SHA-512

column.name: failed_logins
column.description: Number of failed login attempts

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_login_time
column.description: Timestamp when user last logged in.

column.name: last_login_ip_addr
column.description: The IP from which the user last logged in.

column.name: last_login_node_id
column.description: The node where the user last logged in.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

column.name: last_password_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated their password.

column.name: otp_key
column.description: Two Factor Authentication Key.

column.name: is_reset_required
column.description: Indicates if a password reset is required.

column.name: confirm_code
column.description: Confirmation code for email verification and forgot password

column.name: confirm_create_time
column.description: Create time for a confirmation code

column.name: is_glass_break_required
column.description: Indicates if a glass break is required to login as the user.

column.name: break_glass_start_time
column.description: Timestamp when the glass was last broken.

column.name: break_glass_end_time
column.description: Timestamp when the glass break expires.

column.name: break_glass_user_id
column.description: ID of the user who last broke the glass for this user.

table.name: console_user_hist
table.description: A console specific table that is used to store console users login history

column.name: hist_id
column.description: ID for a users history, lower ID's represent earlier passwords

column.name: salt
column.description: Salt used in encryption, null if no salt

column.name: encrypt_meth
column.description: Encryption method for password, i.e. SHA-1 or SHA-512

column.name: user_id
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: event_node_id
column.description: Node the event occurred on

column.name: source_node_id
column.description: Source node of the event

column.name: target_node_id
column.description: Target node of the event

column.name: event_value
column.description: Placeholder for additional information about the event

table.name: console_role
table.description: Role for users to assign privileges to use screens

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: console_role_privilege
table.description: List of privileges for a role

column.name: is_read
column.description: Indicates that this privilege is read only.

column.name: is_write
column.description: Indicates that this privilege is read/write.

column.name: table_name
column.description: The table name representing the statistics

column.name: event_type
column.description: The type of event representing this entry. Valid values are 'I' for insert, 'U' for update, or 'D' for delete.

column.name: start_time
column.description: The start time for the period which this row represents.

column.name: end_time
column.description: The start time for the period which this row represents.

column.name: loaded_rows
column.description: The rows loaded for this table during this period.

column.name: extracted_rows
column.description: The rows extracted for this table during this period.

column.name: id
column.description: A unique identifier

column.name: row_id
column.description: A unique identifier for this row across different versions

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: create_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who created this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

column.name: id
column.description: A unique identifier

column.name: diagram_id
column.description: A unique identifier

column.name: name
column.description: The name to be displayed

column.name: database_type
column.description: The database type this node group represents.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: create_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who created this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: monitor
table.description: Defines monitors that will run periodically to look for problems in the system.

column.name: monitor_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a monitor.

column.name: node_group_id
column.description: Target a specific node group to run this monitor. Target all groups, use a value of 'ALL'.

column.name: external_id
column.description: Target a specific node by its external ID to run this monitor. Target all nodes, use a value of 'ALL'.

column.name: type
column.description: Monitor type to execute. Built-in types are cpu, disk, memory, batchError, batchUnsent, dataGap, dataUnrouted, and log.

column.name: expression
column.description: An expression used by the monitor to set options specific to the monitor type.

column.name: threshold
column.description: The minimum value returned when the monitor runs that will cause a monitor event to be recorded.

column.name: run_period
column.description: Run this monitor periodically every number of seconds.

column.name: run_count
column.description: Average the value across a number of runs before checking threshold.

column.name: display_order
column.description: Numerical ascending order of monitors to display to user.

column.name: is_insight
column.description: Insights are optional recommendations for changing the system settings, while other monitors are for errors that must be resolved.

column.name: is_pinned
column.description: A pinned monitor will be displayed to the user even if there are no unresolved events for it.

column.name: enabled
column.description: Whether or not this monitor is enabled for execution.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: monitor_event
table.description: Records an event of when a system problem occurred.

column.name: monitor_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a monitor that caused the event.

column.name: node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the node that created the event.

column.name: event_time
column.description: Timestamp when the event was created.

column.name: host_name
column.description: Host name of the node that created the event.

column.name: type
column.description: Monitor type that detected the value recorded.

column.name: threshold
column.description: Minimum value for the monitor to cause an event.

column.name: event_value
column.description: Actual value detected by the monitor.

column.name: event_count
column.description: Number of times this event has occurred and been updated.

column.name: severity_level
column.description: Severity level configured for the monitor.

column.name: is_resolved
column.description: Whether an event is resolved because its value dropped below the threshold.

column.name: is_notified
column.description: Whether a notification was run.

column.name: is_insight
column.description: Insights are optional recommendations for changing the system settings, while other monitor events are for errors that must be resolved.

column.name: not_before
column.description: Timestamp before which the recommendation should not be displayed in the web console.

column.name: approved_option
column.description: Identifier for the option that was selected when approving the recommendation.

column.name: approved_by
column.description: The user who approved the event.

column.name: is_approval_processed
column.description: Whether the recommendation's approval has been processed.

column.name: details
column.description: JSON formatted details about the event

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when the event was last updated.

table.name: notification
table.description: Defines what notification to send when a monitor detects a problem in the system.

column.name: notification_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a notification.

column.name: node_group_id
column.description: Target a specific node group to run this notification. To target all groups, use a value of 'ALL'.

column.name: external_id
column.description: Target a specific node by its external ID to run this notification. To target all nodes, use a value of 'ALL'.

column.name: severity_level
column.description: Look for monitor events using this severity level or above. To match all severity levels, use a value of 0.

column.name: type
column.description: Notification type that will send a message. Built-in types are mail and log.

column.name: expression
column.description: An expression used by the notification to set options specific to the notification type.

column.name: enabled
column.description: Whether or not this notication is enabled.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: table_group
table.description: Group of tables to sync together as a dependent unit

column.name: id
column.description: A unique identifier

column.name: source_node_group_id
column.description: The node group where data changes are captured.

column.name: target_node_group_id
column.description: The node group where data changes will be sent.

column.name: description
column.description: Optional description

column.name: writer_type
column.description: Type of writer: D=default, J=JSON

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: create_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who created this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: table_group_hier
table.description: Relationships between tables for finding dependent data

column.name: id
column.description: A unique identifier

column.name: table_group_id
column.description: Link to parent table_group

column.name: source_catalog_name
column.description: Optional name for the catalog the configured table is in.

column.name: source_schema_name
column.description: Optional name for the schema a configured table is in.

column.name: source_table_name
column.description: The name of the source table that will be grouped.

column.name: parent_id
column.description: A unique identifier of parent

column.name: relation_type
column.description: When writer type is non-default, this defines the structure of data in hierarchy when writing output: O=object, A=array

column.name: primary_column_names
column.description: The primary key columns name on this table that uniquely identify a row, comma-separated

column.name: local_column_names
column.description: The local key columns name on this table that reference a parent table, comma-separated

column.name: parent_column_names
column.description: The parent column names on the parent that join with local columns, comma-separated

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: create_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who created this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: compare_request
table.description: Compare one or more tables between source and target nodes with option to repair data

column.name: source_node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the source node.

column.name: target_node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the target node.

column.name: trigger_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a trigger associated with the request, or ALL for all tables.

column.name: router_id
column.description: Unique description of the router associated with the request, or ALL for all tables.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: use_table_checksum
column.description: Use a checksum on the table to detect changes, otherwise a simple row count is used for comparison.

column.name: use_inflight
column.description: Use inflight changes , which are changes in the process of syncing. Currently, it assumes inflight changes will sync successfully, so they are ignored during comparisons. Requires use_table_checksum = 1.

column.name: use_row_level
column.description: When a table count or checksum doesn't match, find the rows that are different, missing, and extra.

column.name: use_chunking
column.description: When finding row differences, use a chunking technique that performs a checksum on groups of rows. Instead of sending all rows with their checksum for comparison, it will send chunks for efficient network communication. The algorithm will limit the number of chunks to 100.

column.name: use_script
column.description: Generates a script of the differences as inserts, updates, and deletes, but does not apply the script. The use_repair option will apply the script.

column.name: use_repair
column.description: Runs the repair script of inserts, updates, and deletes on the target so it matches the source.

column.name: checksum_algorithm
column.description: One of CRC32, PureJavaCrc32, Adler32, or XXHash32

column.name: decimal_scale
column.description: Number of digits to the right of the decimal point to use when comparing numbers.

column.name: timestamp_scale
column.description: Number of digits to the right of the decimal point for fractional seconds to use when comparing timestamps.

column.name: real_scale
column.description: Number of digits to use when comparing floating point numbers.

column.name: not_before
column.description: User requested start time.

column.name: processed
column.description: System field indicates compare_table_status was created.

column.name: completed
column.description: System field to indicate request is complete.

column.name: cancelled
column.description: User can set this flag to interrupt and cancel.

column.name: compare_id
column.description: System field with compare ID sequence.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user or the system last updated this entry.

table.name: compare_status
table.description: Compare one or more tables between source and target nodes with option to repair data

column.name: compare_id
column.description: System field with compare ID sequence.

column.name: source_node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the source node.

column.name: target_node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the target node.

column.name: start_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: end_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: tables_requested
column.description: The number of tables associated with this compare, which is generated by the system.

column.name: tables_compared
column.description: The number of tables completed for this compare, which is generated by the system.

column.name: completed
column.description: System field to indicate request is complete.

column.name: cancelled
column.description: System field to indicate request was cancelled.

column.name: error_flag
column.description: A flag that indicates that this request is in error during the last attempt to process.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user or the system last updated this entry.

table.name: compare_table_status
table.description: Status by table of a compare_request to compare one or more tables.

column.name: compare_id
column.description: Compare ID sequence.

column.name: source_node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the source node.

column.name: step_num
column.description: Step number for each table to compare.

column.name: target_node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the target node.

column.name: current_level
column.description: Level of current comparision. T=table, C=chunk, R=row

column.name: status
column.description: Status of this table comparisons. RQ=requested and queued, NE=new and processing, SE=sent payload for level, OK=complete

column.name: source_catalog_name
column.description: The catalog name where the source table resides.

column.name: source_schema_name
column.description: The schema name where the source table resides.

column.name: source_table_name
column.description: The name of the source table.

column.name: source_row_count
column.description: The number of rows in the source table.

column.name: source_row_count_millis
column.description: Time it took to count rows at source when use_table_checksum = 0.

column.name: source_row_extract_millis
column.description: Time it took to extract all rows at source, either because use_table_checksum = 1 or because use_repair = 1 and the row count is different.

column.name: source_row_extract_size
column.description: The number of bytes extracted to staging from the source table.

column.name: source_row_sort_millis
column.description: Time it took to sort all rows at source, either because use_table_checksum = 1 or because use_repair = 1 and the row count is different

column.name: source_row_checksum_millis
column.description: Time it took to checksum all rows at source, either because use_table_checksum = 1 or because use_repair = 1 and the row count is different

column.name: source_row_filter_millis
column.description: Time it took to filter rows for chunks that didn't match at the source.

column.name: source_table_checksum_millis
column.description: Time it took to checksum the table at source when use_table_checksum = 1

column.name: source_inflight_count
column.description: The number of inflight rows waiting to sync for the source table.

column.name: source_inflight_millis
column.description: The number of millis to process inflight rows.

column.name: source_chunk_millis
column.description: Time it took to process rows into chunks at source.

column.name: target_catalog_name
column.description: The catalog name where the target table resides.

column.name: target_schema_name
column.description: The schema name where the target table resides.

column.name: target_table_name
column.description: The name of the target table.

column.name: target_row_count
column.description: The number of rows in the target table.

column.name: target_row_count_millis
column.description: Time it took to count rows at target when use_table_checksum = 0.

column.name: target_row_extract_millis
column.description: Time it took to extract all rows at target, either because use_table_checksum = 1 or because use_repair = 1 and the row count is different.

column.name: target_row_extract_size
column.description: The number of bytes extracted to staging from the target table.

column.name: target_row_sort_millis
column.description: Time it took to sort all rows at target, either because use_table_checksum = 1 or because use_repair = 1 and the row count is different

column.name: target_row_checksum_millis
column.description: Time it took to checksum all rows at target, either because use_table_checksum = 1 or because use_repair = 1 and the row count is different

column.name: target_row_filter_millis
column.description: Time it took to filter rows for chunks that didn't match at the target.

column.name: target_table_checksum_millis
column.description: Time it took to checksum the table at target when use_table_checksum = 1

column.name: target_inflight_count
column.description: The number of inflight rows waiting to sync for the target table.

column.name: target_inflight_millis
column.description: The number of millis to process inflight rows.

column.name: target_chunk_millis
column.description: Time it took to process rows into chunks at target.

column.name: chunk_match_count
column.description: Number of chunks that matched, if chunk level is used.

column.name: chunk_diff_count
column.description: Number of chunks that did not match, if chunk level is used.

column.name: chunk_diff_list
column.description: List of chunk numbers (up to 200) that are different and need row-level comparison.

column.name: chunk_compare_millis
column.description: Time it took to compare chunks.

column.name: row_match_count
column.description: Number of rows that matched.

column.name: row_diff_count
column.description: Number of rows that did not match.

column.name: row_missing_count
column.description: Number of rows missing on the target.

column.name: row_extra_count
column.description: Number of rows that were extra on the target.

column.name: row_compare_millis
column.description: Time it took to compare rows.

column.name: repair_query_millis
column.description: Time it took to query and write repair script.

column.name: repair_load_millis
column.description: Time it took to load repair script.

column.name: repair_reject_count
column.description: The number of SQL statements that failed to apply from the repair SQL script.

column.name: match_flag
column.description: After status is OK, whether or not source and target tables match.

column.name: ignore_flag
column.description: Indicates this table was ignored by user cancelling request.

column.name: error_flag
column.description: Indicates an error occurred.

column.name: error_message
column.description: When error_flag is set, this contains details on the error.

column.name: start_time
column.description: When comparison for this table started.

column.name: end_time
column.description: When comparison for this table ended.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when the system last updated this entry.
